summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of Corrections Officer Tova Noel, who was working in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on the night Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell. Noel describes the staffing, counts, and procedures during his shift, expresses shock at the death, and voluntarily states he never brought contraband into the jail.

events.title: FBI interview of Corrections Officer Tova Noel
events.description: FBI, Task Force Officer, and OIG Special Agents interviewed Corrections Officer Tova Noel at the U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY, regarding the circumstances of Jeffrey Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, New York
United States Attorneys Office (USAO), Southern District of New York (SDNY), New York, New York
keyFacts: Corrections Officer Tova Noel was working alone in the locked-down Special Housing Unit (10 South) on the 12am-8am shift when Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive.
Noel insisted on having a partner for inmate counts, and Officer Noel assisted him with the 3am and 5am counts where they counted five inmates.
Noel stated Epstein 'was supposed to be watched more closely' and that rounds 'should have been conducted regardless of whether Epstein had previously been on suicide watch or not.'
At the end of the interview, Noel voluntarily stated, 'I want to be clear, I never brought stuff into the jail or allowed stuff in. I never did that.'
The interview was conducted as part of an ongoing criminal investigation, and Noel was advised of his obligation to answer truthfully.
